name: Iluminara: Concert and Supper Club
description:
Enjoy a rare public performance by the Jukebox Duo (Vince and Igor), who will perform two acoustic sets dedicated to the music of The Beatles.

The entire concert and dining experience will be lit exclusively by candlelight, creating an intimate, romantic atmosphere.

name: The Barrel Boys: Bluegrass Christmas
description:
Celebrate the holiday season with one of Canada's most beloved bluegrass bands. 

Their enchanting melodies and heartwarming harmonies bring a delightful blend of folk, bluegrass and Americana to your seasonal festivities. From timeless carols to original compositions, their holiday show captures the season's essence, infusing every note with warmth and memory. 

Come to this magical Christmas show that will fill your heart with joy and leave you with cherished memories.

Established in 2012, The Barrel Boys are a bluegrass powerhouse with soaring harmonies, blazing picking and an infectious stage presence. Their music blends tradition and originality into a soulful roots experience that has earned the Boys a special place in the hearts of Canadian music fans from coast to coast. 

In June 2025, they released Chicken in the Window, their fourth full-length album of original music.

name: Create/Change: Toronto's GivingTuesday Collab
description:
Uniting Toronto's arts and nonprofit communities for an evening of creativity and collective impact.

Proceeds from this evening will support youth-focused programs in arts, STEM, and innovation. These initiatives include WoodGreen Community Services' Homeward Bound program and artist-led summer workshops in art, dance, and music for children of single mothers; ACCESS Charity's Bright Ideas Pitch, which provides microgrants and mentorship for youth-led social good projects; Vengeance Foundation's Vengeance in Action and Bits & Bytes Hackathon, offering arts and tech programs for youth; and Code to Inspire, which delivers coding education to young women in Afghanistan.

Guests will enjoy live performances, art, and community.

name: Oscar Peterson Program

location.name: Koerner Hall, Royal Conservatory of Music

description: We proudly present student concerts featuring solo and chamber works, and the Oscar Peterson Program Orchestra conducted by Artistic Director Colin Clarke.

name: Speaker's Series: Art in the Park
description:
Experience Ontario's rich and diverse history come to life through this collection of engaging, in-person talks that celebrate the people, places, and moments that shape our province. 

Learn more on the fascinating art treasures displayed proudly on the walls at Queen's Park and the stories they tell about Ontario's history and people. 

Enjoy light refreshments and a moderated QnA with the Honourable Donna Skelly, Speaker of the Legislative Assembly of Ontario.
